h1. Textile Quick Reference Markup (in Textile) is shown on a pink background. The result is shown directly underneath without background. Any notes are on a blue background. Please compare with the "Original hobix.com Quick Reference published on redcloth.org":http://redcloth.org/hobix.com/textile/quick.html on which this reference is based. For more details please see HelpOnFormattingNotes. h2(prop). I. Writing in textile pre(ex). A single paragraph Followed by another A single paragraph Followed by another pre(ex). 
I am very serious.
I am very serious.
p(exnote). Unlike Textile 2.0 !TapirWiki renders the @
@ tags as normal html.

pre(ex). I spoke.
And none replied.

I spoke. 
And none replied.

p(exnote). !TapirWiki substitutes newlines with @
@

pre(ex). "Observe"

"Observe!"

pre(ex). Observe -- very nice!

Observe -- very nice!

pre(ex). Observe - tiny and brief.

Observe - tiny and brief.

pre(ex). Observe...

Observe...

pre(ex). Observe: 2 x 2.

Observe: 2 x 2.

pre(ex). one(TM), two(R), three(C).

one(TM), two(R), three(C).

h2(prop). II. Quick Block Modifiers

pre(ex). h1. Header 1

h1. Header 1

pre(ex). h2. Header 2

h2. Header 2

pre(ex). h3. Header 3

h3. Header 3

pre(ex). An old text
 
bq. A block quotation.
 
Any old text

An old text

bq. A block quotation.

Any old text

p(exnote). The bq. modifier has an extended version bq.. which allows empty lines in the block quoted. It is concluded by another Textile block modifier such as p. or h1. 

pre(ex). bc.
 function replacechar(match){
 if (match=="<"){
 return "<";
 }
 ...
 

bc.
 function replacechar(match){
 if (match=="<"){
 return "<";
 }
 ...

p(exnote). In !TapirWiki use the ==bc. or bc.. == modifier to render blocks of (html) source code as text. *Not* a @
.....
@ construct as code within such a construct is still interpreted as html. The extended (bc..) version allows empty lines and is concluded by another textile block modifier as p. or h1.

pre(ex). This is covered elsewhere[1].

This is covered elsewhere[1].

pre(ex). fn1. Down here, in fact.

fn1. Down here, in fact.

pre(ex). 
dl. Defintion list
dt. Term
dd. Definition

dl. Definition List
dt. Term
dd. Definition


p(exnote). You have to finish the definition list with two blank lines. This is to allow blank lines between term-definition pairs. 

h2(prop). III. Quick Phrase Modifiers

pre(ex). I _believe_ every word.

I _believe_ every word.

pre(ex). And then? She *fell*!

And then? She *fell*!

pre(ex). I __know__.
I **really** __know__.

I __know__.
I **really** __know__.

pre(ex). ??Cat's Cradle?? by Vonnegut

??Cat's Cradle?? by Vonnegut

pre(ex). Convert with @r.to_html@

Convert with @r.to_html@

pre(ex). I'm -sure- not sure.

I'm -sure- not sure.

pre(ex). You are a +pleasant+ child.

You are a +pleasant+ child.

pre(ex). a ^2^ + b ^2^ = c ^2^

a ^2^ + b ^2^ = c ^2^

pre(ex). log ~2~ x

log ~2~ x

pre(ex). I'm %unaware% of most soft drinks.

I'm %unaware% of most soft drinks.

pre(ex). I'm %{color:red}unaware% of most soft drinks.

I'm %{color:red}unaware% of most soft drinks.

pre(ex). In case you want to escape textile inline: ==+some+ *escaped* _textile_==

In case you want to escape textile inline: ==+some+ *escaped* _textile_==

p(exnote). There is also a block modifier to escape textile: @notextile.@ (no extended version though, an apparent lapse by the parser's author)

h2(prop). IV. Attributes 

pre(ex). p(example1). An example

p(example1). An example

pre(ex). p(#big-red). Red here

p(#big-red). Red here

pre(ex). p(example1#big-red2). Red here

p(example1#big-red2). Red here

pre(ex). p{color:blue;margin:30px}. Spacey blue

p{color:blue;margin:30px}. Spacey blue

pre(ex). p[fr]. rouge

p[fr]. rouge

pre(ex). I seriously *{color:red}blushed* when I _(big)sprouted_ that corn stalk from my %[es]cabeza%.

I seriously *{color:red}blushed* when I _(big)sprouted_ that corn stalk from my %[es]cabeza%.

pre(ex). p<. align left

p<. align left

pre(ex). p>. align right

p>. align right

pre(ex). p=. centered

p=. centered

pre(ex). p<>. justified

p<>. justified

pre(ex). p(. left ident 1em

p(. left ident 1em

pre(ex). p((. left ident 2em

p((. left ident 2em

pre(ex). p)))>. right ident 3em right aligned

p)))>. right ident 3em right aligned

pre(ex). h2()>. Bingo.

h2()>. Bingo.

pre(ex). h3()>[no]{color:red}. Bingo

h3()>[no]{color:red}. Bingo

p(exnote). For more details on attributes and the attribute order please see HelpOnFormattingNotes.


pre(ex). 

 

 Sidebar 

 
Hobix
Ruby
 


 
The main text of the
page goes here and will 
stay to the left of the 
sidebar.





 Sidebar 


Hobix
Ruby




The main text of the
page goes here and will 
stay to the left of the 
sidebar.

p(exnote). !TapirWiki does not allow mixing Textile an HTML block. Unlike the Textile 2.0 reference implemenation, !TapirWike does not tamper HTML unless it appears within a pre. or bc. block (then it just rendered as text). You can put HTML virtually anywhere in your text.

h2(prop). V. Lists

pre(ex). # A first item
# A second item
# A third

# A first item
# A second item
# A third

pre(ex). # Fuel could be:
## Coal
## Gasoline
## Electricity
# Humans need only:
## Water
## Protein

# Fuel could be:
## Coal
## Gasoline
## Electricity
# Humans need only:
## Water
## Protein

pre(ex). * A first item
* A second item
* A third

* A first item
* A second item
* A third

pre(ex). * Fuel could be:
** Coal
** Gasoline
** Electricity
* Humans need only:
** Water
** Protein

* Fuel could be:
** Coal
** Gasoline
** Electricity
* Humans need only:
** Water
** Protein

pre(ex). # Fuel could be:
* Coal
* Gasoline
* Electricity
# Humans need only:
* Water
* Protein

# Fuel could be:
* Coal
* Gasoline
* Electricity
# Humans need only:
* Water
* Protein

p(exnote). !TapirWiki allows mixed lists but remember that when starting a sublist of a different kind you don't need to indent it for the higher levels.

h2(prop). VI. External References

pre(ex). I searched "Google":http://google.com.

I searched "Google":http://google.com.

pre(ex). I am crazy about "Hobix":hobix
and "it's":hobix "all":hobix I ever
"link to":hobix!
 
[hobix]http://hobix.com

I am crazy about "Hobix":hobix
and "it's":hobix "all":hobix I ever
"link to":hobix!

[hobix]http://hobix.com

pre(ex). !http://redcloth.org/hobix.com/textile/sample.jpg!

!http://redcloth.org/hobix.com/textile/sample.jpg!

pre(ex). !_design/tapir/graphics/openwindow1.gif(Bunny.)!

!_design/tapir/graphics/openwindow1.gif(Bunny.)!
 
pre(ex). !_design/tapir/graphics/openwindow1.gif!:http://hobix.com/

!_design/tapir/graphics/openwindow1.gif!:http://hobix.com/

pre(ex). !>_design/tapir/graphics/obake.gif!
 
And others sat all round the small
machine and paid it to sing to them.

!>_design/tapir/graphics/obake.gif!

And others sat all round the small
machine and paid it to sing to them.

p(exnote). Use @!filename!@ to refer to files that you have attached to the page proper.

pre(ex). We use CSS(Cascading Style Sheets).

We use CSS(Cascading Style Sheets).

h2(prop). VII. Tables

pre(ex). |\2. spans two cols |
| col 1 | col 2 |

|\2. spans two cols |
| col 1 | col 2 |

pre(ex). |/3. spans 3 rows | a |
| b |
| c |

|/3. spans 3 rows | a |
| b |
| c |

pre(ex). |{background:#ddd}. Grey cell|

|{background:#ddd}. Grey cell|

pre(ex). table{border:2px solid black}.
|This|is|a|row|
|This|is|a|row|

table{border:2px solid black}.
|This|is|a|row|
|This|is|a|row|

pre(ex). |This|is|a|row|
{background:#ddd}. |This|is|grey|row|

|This|is|a|row|
{background:#ddd}. |This|is|grey|row|

pre(ex). 
|_. Column 1 |_. Column 2|
| In !TapirWiki cells can contain blocks.
Like a list for example:
* My List item 1
* My List item 2
   
Even newlines
|^. This cell is vertically aligned to the top. 
It would normally appear in the middle.
 Use ~ to align it to the bottom |

|_. Column 1 |_. Column 2|
| In !TapirWiki cells can contain blocks.
Like a list for example:
* My List item 1
* My List item 2

Even newlines
|^. This cell is vertically aligned to the top. 
It would normally appear in the middle.
 Use ~ to align it to the bottom |

p(exnote). !TapirWiki's parser allows blocks within block. So a list in a table cell for example. However, the Textile standard and !TapirWiki's implementation do not support complex tables (tables within tables) you need to resort to HTML for that.
